briefTitle: Growth and Adiposity in Newborns: The Influence of Prenatal Docosahexaenoic Acid (DHA) Supplementation
officialTitle: Growth and Adiposity in Newborns: The Influence of Prenatal Docosahexaenoic Acid (DHA) Supplementation

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Participants for this study are invited from the parent study, ADORE. Eligibility listed reflects criteria for the ADORE study.

Inclusion Criteria:

* Agree to consume study capsules and a typical prenatal supplement of 200 mg DHA
* Available by telephone

Exclusion Criteria:

* Expecting multiple infants
* Gestational age at baseline \<12 weeks or \>20 weeks
* Unable or unwilling to agree to consume capsules until delivery
* Unwilling to discontinue use of another prenatal supplement with DHA that contains â‰¥ 200 mg DHA
* Women with allergy to any component of DHA product (including algae), soybean oil or corn oil

primary.description: Difference in FM in offspring exposed to high vs. low DHA and excessive vs. non-excessive GWG

secondary.description: Difference in FM in offspring exposed to high vs. low DHA and excessive vs. non-excessive GWG
